member.name: P:Yarn.Compiler.CompilationResult.StringTable
member.summary: Gets a dictionary mapping line IDs to StringInfo objects.
member.remarks: The string table contains the extracted line text found in the provided source code. The keys of this dictionary are the line IDs for each line - either through explicit line tags indicated through the #line: tag, or implicitly-generated line IDs that the compiler added during compilation.

member.summary: Gets the collection of variable declarations that were found during compilation.

member.name: P:Yarn.Compiler.CompilationResult.ContainsImplicitStringTags
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the compiler had to create line IDs for lines in the source code that lacked #line: tags.

remarks.para: Every line is required to have a line ID. If a line doesn't have a line ID specified in the source code (via a #line: tag), the compiler will create one.

Implicit line IDs are guaranteed to remain the same between compilations when the source file does not change. If you want line IDs to remain the same when the source code may be modified in the future, add a #line: tag to the line. This may be done by hand, or added using the method.

member.name: P:Yarn.Compiler.CompilationResult.FileTags
member.summary: Gets the collection of file-level tags found in the source code.
member.remarks: The keys of this dictionary are the file names (as indicated by the property of the 's collection), and the values are the file tags associated with that file.

member.name: M:Yarn.Compiler.FileCompiler.EnterNode(Yarn.Compiler.YarnSpinnerParser.NodeContext)
member.summary: We have found a new node. Set up the currentNode var ready to hold it, and otherwise continue.

member.name: M:Yarn.Compiler.FileCompiler.ExitNode(Yarn.Compiler.YarnSpinnerParser.NodeContext)
member.summary: We have left the current node. Store it into the program, wipe the var, and make it ready to go again.

member.name: M:Yarn.Compiler.FileCompiler.ExitHeader(Yarn.Compiler.YarnSpinnerParser.HeaderContext)
member.summary: We have finished with the header, so we're about to enter the node body, and all its statements. Do the initial setup required before compiling.

member.name: M:Yarn.Compiler.FileCompiler.EnterBody(Yarn.Compiler.YarnSpinnerParser.BodyContext)
member.summary: Have entered the body. The header should have finished being parsed, and the currentNode is ready. All we do is set up a body visitor and tell it to run through all the statements. It handles everything from that point onwards.

member.name: M:Yarn.Compiler.FileCompiler.ExitBody(Yarn.Compiler.YarnSpinnerParser.BodyContext)
member.summary: Closes off the node.

member.name: T:Yarn.Compiler.FileParseResult
member.summary: Contains the result of parsing a single file of source code.
member.remarks: This class provides only syntactic information about a parse - that is, it provides access to the parse tree, and the stream of tokens used to produce that parse tree.

member.name: T:Yarn.Compiler.IndentAwareLexer
member.summary: A Lexer subclass that detects newlines and generates indent and dedent tokens accordingly.

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the lexer is currently lexing an expression that's part of a 'when' clause.
member.remarks: This value is set by .

member.name: M:Yarn.Compiler.IndentAwareLexer.SetInWhenClause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the lexer is currently lexing an expression that's part of a 'when' clause.
member.remarks: This value can be accessed by calling .

member.name: F:Yarn.Compiler.IndentAwareLexer.pendingTokens
member.summary: The collection of tokens that we have seen, but have not yet returned. This is needed when NextToken encounters a newline, which means we need to buffer indents or dedents. NextToken only returns a single at a time, which means we use this list to buffer it.

member.name: F:Yarn.Compiler.IndentAwareLexer.warnings
member.summary: The collection of objects we've generated.

member.name: F:Yarn.Compiler.IndentAwareLexer.unbalancedIndents
member.summary: A stack keeping track of the levels of indentations we have seen so far that are relevant to shortcuts.

member.name: F:Yarn.Compiler.IndentAwareLexer.lastIndent

member.name: P:Yarn.Compiler.BasicBlock.PlayerVisibleContent
member.summary: Gets the collection of player-visible content that will be delivered when this block is run.

remarks.para: Player-visible content means lines, options and commands. When this block is run, the entire contents of this collection will be displayed to the player, in the same order as they appear in this collection.
If this collection is empty, then the block contains no visible content. This is the case for blocks that only contain logic, and do not contain any lines, options or commands.
remarks.example:
To tell the difference between the different kinds of content, use the operator to check the type of each item:
foreach (var item in block.PlayerVisibleContent) { if (item is LineElement line) { // Do something with line } }
